isis.stitle: DT-466E and 530E Diesel Engine Service (1995 through 1999) - SECTION 13: FUEL SYSTEM - FUEL SYSTEM - INSTALLATION

step1.para: If it was necessary to remove the supply manifold, refer to Section 12, "High Pressure Lube Oil System" installation procedures.
Install supply pump to high pressure pump housing. Secure with three (3) bolts. Tighten to the standard torque value.

Figure 13.22
shows the engine equipped with the front mounted hand primer pump.

Figure 13.23
shows the engine equipped with a top mounted hand primer pump.

figure.caption: Figure 13.22 Install Supply Pump On Engines Equipped With A Front Mounted Hand Primer Pump
Figure 13.23 Install Supply Pump On Engines Equipped With A Top Mounted Hand Primer Pump

step1.para:
Mount the fuel filter header as follows: Figure 13.24
shows the engine equipped with the front mounted hand primer pump. Figure 13.25
shows the engine equipped with a top mounted hand primer pump. Figure 13.25
shows an engine equipped with the engine mounted ECM unit.

step2.para: Insert the header at the crankcase mounting pad. Fasten the header using the two mounting bolts and washers.
Tighten the mounting bolts to the standard torque value.
Remove nylon cap above fuel strainer and observe check ball. If check ball is not in this location, priming pump will not work.

figure.caption: Figure 13.24 Install Front Mounted Hand Primer Pump
Figure 13.25 Install Top Mounted Hand Primer Pump

note.para: When installing hollow screw end fitting fuel lines, be sure to USE NEW COPPER GASKETS.

step1.para:
Install the supply pump return to the fuel filter header return line as follows: Figure 13.26
shows the engine equipped with the front mounted hand primer pump. Figure 13.27
shows the engine equipped with a top mounted hand primer pump. Figure 13.28
shows an engine equipped with the engine mounted ECM unit.

step2.para: Remove protective caps from supply pump and fuel filter header inlet ports.
HOLLOW SCREW FUEL LINE. Secure with hollow screws and new copper sealing gaskets. Tighten to the special torque value.
THREADED FITTING FUEL LINE. Position the line to the supply pump and fuel filter header. Tighten end fittings.

step1.para:
Install a new strainer as follows ( Figure 13.35
).

step2.para: Lubricate the threads of the strainer cover and install a new O-Ring.
Install strainer in cover and hand-tighten into fuel filter header.

note.para: INSTALL STRAINER WITH OPEN END TOWARD FILTER HEADER.

step1.para:
Install a new fuel filter as follows ( Figure 13.36
).

note.para: Engines equipped with a top mounted hand primer pump shown. Engines equipped with a front mounted hand primer pump use the same procedure.

step2.para: Lubricate the filter gasket with clean diesel fuel.
Tighten until the gasket touches the filter header.
Tighten by hand an additional 1/2 turn.

note.para: DO NOT CRANK ENGINE FOR MORE THAN 15 SECOND INTERVALS.
